DataElement.preferredName: BF-Diary Assessing OIC Pain Felt Around Rectum During Bowel Movement Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much pain they had around their rectum during this bowel movement, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bowel Function Diary for Assessing Opioid-Induced Constipation Quantity Pain Felt Around Rectum During this Bowel Movement Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to capture relevant patient information regarding opioid-induced constipation in a clinical trial setting. Three modules record information on bowel movements, symptoms experienced, and treatments used to relieve constipation._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._A question about how much pain an individual had around their rectum._Occurring in the course of the current bowel movement._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Bowel Function Diary for Assessing Opioid-Induced Constipation (BF-Diary)
How much pain did you have ar
ReferenceDocuments.description: How much pain did you have around your rectum during this bowel movement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
